xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received February 13, 2004; revised May 4, 2004. This work was supported in part by the Italian Ministry of Education, University, and Research (MIUR) under Project COFIN 2004 and in part by the Italian Space Agency (ASI), ECOSAR Project.

organization.$: Inst. of Appl. Phys. Nello Ccarrara

head.citation-title: A global quality measurement of pan-sharpened multispectral imagery
head.abstracts: This letter focuses on quality assessment of fusion of multispectral (MS) images with high-resolution panchromatic (Pan) observations. A new quality index suitable for MS imagery having four spectral bands is defined from the theory of hyper-complex numbers, or quaternions. Both spectral and radiometric distortion measurements are encapsulated in a unique measurement, simultaneously accounting for local mean bias, changes in contrast, and loss of correlation of individual bands, together with spectral distortion. Results are presented and discussed on very high-resolution QuickBird data, through comparisons between state-of-the-art and advanced MS + Pan merge algorithms.

source.sourcetitle: IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters
